This calculator gives an estimate of your non-domestic rates bill for 2021-22. It also shows which council is responsible for your rates.

Non-domestic rates are often referred to as 'business rates'.

The calculator does not show all the reliefs (discounts) you might be able to get. It only shows the universal relief and the Small Business Bonus Scheme.

To use the calculator, you'll need:

  • the property postcode, or
  • the street

By continuing, you agree that you have read and understood the disclaimer.

Disclaimer

This calculator gives an estimate of your non-domestic rates bill. The exact amount you'll need to pay (your net liability) can only be provided by your local council when it sends your rates bill.

The calculator currently uses draft revaluations (rateable values) which are available at www.saa.gov.uk.

We accept no liability for the information provided by this calculator.

Reliefs (discounts) and net liability may not be comprehensive if the property receives other discretionary reliefs. Please contact your local council for further information.

Read more information on non-domestic rates.

If you want to know more about any extra reliefs, you can:

  • find more information non-domestic rates reliefs
  • contact your local council for advice

If you have more than one business property, it might affect your eligibility for the Small Business Bonus Scheme.

You can add additional properties.

Extra reliefs available

You might be able to get extra reliefs. You can:

  • find more information on business rates reliefs
  • contact your local council for advice

What to do next?

The exact amount you'll pay can only be provided by your local council when it sends you your rates bill.

A rates bill will be issued when you notify the council of your move to the new premises.
